Author: jl777c#5810
Content:

Content: it makes a copy of the mempool and makes sure they are all valid

Content: then at 4675:         // here we add back all txs from the temp mempool to the main mempool.

Content: they are added back in. you can check to see if that process is filtering out these missing tx

Content: The thing that is strange is that it happens only on some txs and not all the time. So how come it cannot find inputs... I'm thinking that it is because I'm broadcasting 3 txs fast from TUI so the inputs used for 3rd could be the output from 2nd that does not exists yet, but I have not yet looked how this checks the outputs...

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I mean, this check is just checking if the tx refering an input exists, later it checks it the exact inputs exist (line 1740 - main.cpp)

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ohhhh, it may be the order of adding the tx to mempool. In the beggining txs are removed from mempool (line 4678) and then they are pushed back to mempool (line 4765). Could be that at the moment the refering tx is not in the mempool so this cannot find it.
